title: Feed and rations for backgrounding Nov 2020

tasks.task: Visit about feed rations for backgrounding cattle in fall 2020.
subtasks: Introduce himself as Carl Hoppe, Extension Livestock Specialist.
Mention new calf crops in 2020 and their sizes (January-born big, April and June-born smaller).
Explain backgrounding vs. stocker cattle in Northern Plains.
Discuss the relationship between corn prices and feedstuff costs.
Outline historical feedstuff prices from 2017 to 2020, noting trends in corn, distillers grains, hay, and wheat mids.
Highlight the availability of co-product feeds in North Dakota, including distillers grains, wheat middlings, and soybean meal.
Detail the daily nutrient needs for cattle, focusing on energy and protein requirements.
Explain the calculation of feed costs per pound of growth (gain), considering TDN and protein costs.
Address feed issues in North Dakota 2020, such as early frost damage to corn silage.
Present balanced rations for 700-pound steers, varying hay and grain proportions to achieve different rates of gain (e.g., 2.6, 2.8, 3.1 pounds per day).
Discuss varying feed costs per pound of gain based on different rations and feeding strategies.
Explore market considerations and the impact of feeding rates on performance and prices.
Emphasize bedding and feed management practices, such as clean water, bedding, and proper ration adaptation.
Mention feed additives like anophores, ear implants, and anti-coccidial treatments to improve feed efficiency and prevent health issues.

tasks.task: Visit about feed rations for backgrounding cattle in fall 2020.**
